減.definition: to lower; to decrease; to reduce; to subtract; to diminish

減俸.definition: to lower salary; to reduce pay

減價.definition: to cut prices; to discount; to mark down; price cutting

減免.definition: to reduce or waive (taxes, punishment, rent, tuition etc)

減分.definition: to deduct points; to lose points

減刑.definition: to reduce penalty; shortened or commuted (judicial) sentence

減員.definition: to reduce the number of personnel; to experience a reduction in the number of personnel

減壓時間表.definition: decompression schedule (diving); also called 減壓程序|减压程序[jian3 ya1 cheng2 xu4]

減壓病.definition: decompression sickness; the bends; also 減壓症|减压症[jian3 ya1 zheng4]

減壓症.definition: decompression sickness; the bends; also 減壓病|减压病[jian3 ya1 bing4]

減小.definition: to reduce; to decrease; to diminish

減少.definition: to lessen; to decrease; to reduce; to lower

減幅.definition: amount of reduction; size of discount

減持.definition: (of an investor) to reduce one's holdings

減排.definition: to reduce pollutant discharge; to reduce emissions

減損.definition: to impair; to degrade; to decrease; to reduce; to weaken; to detract from; impairment (e.g. of financial assets)

減核.definition: nuclear weapons reduction (abbr. for 裁減核武器|裁减核武器[cai2 jian3 he2 wu3 qi4]); disarmament

減災.definition: to take measures to mitigate the impact of disasters (including prevention, preparation, and support for stricken communities)

減產.definition: to produce less; to reduce output; lower yield

減脂.definition: to burn fat; to lose weight (through diet or exercise)

減色.definition: to fade; (fig.) to lose luster; (of an event etc) to be spoiled; (coinage) to become debased

減計.definition: to write down (i.e. to decrease the expected value of a loan)

減負.definition: to alleviate a burden on sb

減輕.definition: to lighten; to ease; to alleviate

減退.definition: to ebb; to go down; to decline

減速.definition: to reduce speed; to slow down

減除.definition: to reduce; to lessen (pain etc); to deduct (from taxes)
